intro: Fimbristylis annamica, commonly known as the Annam sedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, preferring moist, acidic soils. Its leaves are linear and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous, arranged in dense spikelets. Fimbristylis annamica plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
